full_summary:
**Global Positioning System (GPS) Solution Contract**
================================================iants

### Invitation to Tender

The Senate of Canada is inviting qualified bidders to submit proposals for the supply, delivery and installation of a cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) Global Positioning System (GPS) solution. The scope of work includes the provision of a GPS tracking and monitoring system for the Senate's fleet of vehicles, with detailed reporting and alert notifications.

### Key Requirements

* The GPS system must be cloud-based and accessible through a web interface
* The system must provide detailed tracking and reporting on a daily, weekly and monthly basis
* The system must provide service alert notifications
* The system must be scalable and capable of handling the Senate's fleet of vehicles

### Tender Details

* **Refer CI Exemption:** If your proposal includes any categorized information (i.e., proprietary information), please clearly label it as "CI" so we can keep it secure and in compliance with our segmentation policies. 

* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-09-13T11:00:00
* **Solicitation Number:** SEN-028 23-24
* **Publication Date:** 2023-08-23

### Bid Submissions

* Proposals must be submitted electronically to https://canadabuys.canada.ca/ using the specified templates.
* Proposals must be received by the closing date and time specified in this Notice.
* Enquiries regarding this tender must be submitted by email to Proc-Appr@sen.parl.gc.ca no later than September 5, 2023.

### Evaluation Criteria

* Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:
	+ Technical Merit: The bidder's technical approach and solution.
	+ Price: The bidder's proposed price for the solution.

### Contact Information

* For any further information or clarifications, please contact Shirley Chartrand at (Proc-appr@sen.parl.gc.ca) or (613995-8888).

### Disclaimer

The Senate of Canada reserves the right to reject any or all bids, to delay the award of the contract, or to negotiate with bidders. By submitting a proposal, bidders acknowledge that they have read and understood the requirements of this tender and that they are willing to abide by the terms and conditions of the contract.

Note: All the optional fields regarding trade agreements, regions of Opportunity, and regions of delivery remained as "None" so I have simply removed those fields as there is no information to mention
